author: Jessica Gibb
title: Ashley Cole gushes about his first child as ex-wife Cheryl prepares to give birth
text:
Sharon Canu and Ashley Cole (Photo: REX/Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Cheryl only confirmed she was expecting their first child officially last week. 
And now her ex-husband Ashley Cole has taken to Twitter to gush about how wonderful fatherhood is. 
The footballer wrote a tribute to his son to mark him turning one on Tuesday. 
Ashley became a father for the first time last year after welcoming a son with Italian model Sharon Canu after just six months of dating. 
“I’ve been incredibly fortunate to have most things I’ve wanted in life: Cars, houses, watches, clothes," he wrote in the heartfelt post. 
“Coming from East London with not a lot growing up, and a mum looking after two boys alone, life wasn’t easy. So of course it’s easy to lose your way in life sometimes – to forget about the things that are most important. “Every day I wake up to the most beautiful thing I could dream of: A son that makes my heart melt, a son that never stops smiling, a son that can make me laugh no matter what kind of mood I’m in, a son that I’m proud of, a son I watch fall asleep because I never want to leave him, a son who reminded me what’s most important in life.” May 2009: Ashley Cole in Manchester with Cheryl Cole where she is judging on X-Factor auditions. 
Ashley and Cheryl split in 2010 after just four years of marriage. 
And after months of pregnancy rumours, it was only last week that Cheryl finally confirmed her pregnancy in a poignant campaign and video for The Princes Trust and L'Oreal. 
Standing with a smile on her face, cradling her bump, dressed in a form-fitting knitted dress, Cheryl looked positively glowing. 
However, the campaign has a serious edge to it, as the message behind the campaign for The Prince’s Trust and L’Oreal Paris is to launch a three-year collaboration to help raise the confidence of 10,000 young people across the UK who are struggling with self-doubt. Cautious (Photo: A J Odudu/Youtube) "She was scared that after years of bad luck, she may jinx the best thing that ever happened to her," a source told Closer (Photo: GC Images)
